Title.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at a tertiary care hospital.

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealed by sealed envelopes.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adult patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB. Eligibility criteria included age 18-75 years and no pre-existing renal disease.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received optimized CPB procedures, while the control group underwent standard CPB.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the impact of CPB on AKI incidence and explore preventive strategies.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of AKI within 7 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealed by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a reduced AKI incidence (20% vs. 35%, p = 0.02).

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported; mild gastrointestinal side-effects occurred in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.

Funding.evidence: Funding: This study was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
